title: Sonification-Based Creative Teaching Method Development for STEAM Education Innovation

context.prior_knowledge: Foundational science/technology concepts and general understanding of music and arts
context.additional_context: Course for university students to strengthen scientific data sonification and content creation skills using musical elements through an interdisciplinary approach

learning_goals: Students can creatively express scientific data using sound mapping technology (parameter mapping).
Learners enhance convergent thinking by composing new song lyrics and producing music that reflect STEM concepts.

Learners can apply three or more empathetic communication techniques (e.g., active listening, feedback provision, role allocation) in a 4-member sonification project, demonstrate collaboration skills through project deliverables and peer evaluations (5-point scale, average â‰¥4.0).
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
